Title: Determining the heart rate by using speech signal
Affiliations: Industrial Engineering Department, Master of Industrial Engineering Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan, Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Gunawan, F.E., Industrial Engineering Department, Master of Industrial Engineering Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan, Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Pratiwi, M., Industrial Engineering Department, Master of Industrial Engineering Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan, Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Heart disease is known to be one of the primary causes of death worldwide. In the United States, the disease is the leading cause of death for people of most ethnicities. In Indonesia, the disease contributes 17% of the total mortality. It is also well-known that a regular or continuous monitoring the heart rate is necessary to minimize the fatality. At the current technological state, the monitoring method is expensive and often requires a wearable sensor, which is inconvenient. This study intends to establish a relationship between the heart rate and speech signals empirically by using regression and correlation analysis. The speech signals are analyzed through a frequency analysis using fast Fourier transform. The results suggest that vowel ‘e’ speech signal has a strong correlation to the heart rate. © 2019, ICIC International. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Fast Fourier transform; Heart rate; Relative error; Vowel speech signals
References: Zennifa, F., Kamil, H., Iramina, K., Prototype early warning system for heart disease detection using android application (2014) The 36Th Annual International Conference of the IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society (EMBC), Pp, pp. 3468-3471; http://www.worldlifeexpectancy.com/indonesia-coronary-heart-disease, Retrieved on February 2, 2015; Celermajer, D.S., Chow, C.K., Marijon, E., Anstey, N.M., Woo, K.S., Cardiovascular disease in the developing world: Prevalences, patterns, and the potential of early disease detection (2012) Journal of the American College of Cardiology, 60 (14), pp. 1207-1216. , vol., no., pp; Hung, H.C., Wei, D., Muscle noise cancellation in four-lead ecg system for ubiquitous healthcare (2009) Joint Conferences on Pervasive Computing (JCPC), Pp, pp. 115-118; Bakar, A.A.A., Lim, Y.L., Wilson, S.J., Fuentes, M., Bertling, K., Bosch, T., Rakic, A.D., Electrocardiographic signal detection using self-mixing interferometer technique with customized electro-optic phase modulator (2012) The 3Rd International Conference on Photonics; Chen, D.-Y., Wang, J.-J., Lin, K.-Y., Chang, H.-H., Wu, H.-K., Chen, Y.-S., Lee, S.-Y., Image sensor-based heart rate evaluation from face reflectance using Hilbert-Huang transform (2015) IEEE Sensors Journal, 15 (1), pp. 618-627. , vol., no., pp; Mesleh, A., Skopin, D., Baglikov, S., Quteishat, A., Heart rate extraction from vowel speech signals (2012) Journal of Computer Science and Technology, 27 (6), pp. 1243-1251. , vol., no., pp; Skopin, D., Baglikov, S., Heartbeat feature extraction from vowel speech signal using 2D spectrum representation (2009) Proc. of the 4Th Int. Authors: Pratiwi M., Alexander, Harefa J., Nanda S.
Title: Mammograms Classification Using Gray-level Co-occurrence Matrix and Radial Basis Function Neural Network
Affiliations: Industrial Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl KH Syahdan 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Pratiwi, M., Industrial Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl KH Syahdan 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Alexander, Industrial Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl KH Syahdan 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Harefa, J., Industrial Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl KH Syahdan 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Nanda, S., Industrial Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl KH Syahdan 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Computer Aided Diagnosis (CAD) is used to assist radiologist in classifying various type of breast cancers. It already proved its success not only in reducing human error in reading the mammograms but also shows better and reliable classification into benign and malignant abnormalities.This paper will report and attempt on using Radial Basis Function Neural Network (RBFNN) for mammograms classification based on Gray-level Co-occurrence Matrix (GLCM) texture based features.In this study, normal and abnormal breast image used as the standard input are taken from Mammographic Image Analysis Society (MIAS) digital mammogram database. The computational experiments show that RBFNN is better than Back-propagation Neural Network (BPNN) in performing breast cancer classification. For normal and abnormal classification, the result shows that RBFNN's accuracy is93.98%, which is 14% higher than BPNN, while the accuracy of benign and malignant classification is 94.29% which is 2% higher than BPNN. © 2015 The Authors. Published by Elsevier B.V.
Author Keywords: GLCM; Mammogram; Radial Basis Function Neural Network
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Backpropagation; Computer aided diagnosis; Diseases; Functions; Mammography; Medical imaging; Neural networks; Radial basis function networks; X ray screens; Back-propagation neural networks; Breast cancer classifications; Computer Aided Diagnosis(CAD); GLCM; Gray level co occurrence matrix(GLCM); Gray level co-occurrence matrix; Mammogram; Radial basis function neural networks; Classification (of information)
